str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From sun and erchomai; to convene, depart in company with, associate with, or, cohabit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and ginomai; to become near, i.e. Approach; by implication, to appear publicly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From ana and ago; to lead up; by extension to bring out; specially, to sail away.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of a derivative of huper; a higher part of the house, i.e. Apartment in the third story.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Feminine of a presumed derivative apparently from the base of chasma through the idea of deficiency; a widow, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Or prolonged paristano from para and histemi; to stand beside, i.e. to exhibit, proffer, recommend, substantiate; or to be at hand, aid.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: To show, display, point out, indicate; I prove, demonstrate. From epi and deiknuo; to exhibit.
A tunic, garment, undergarment. Of foreign origin; a tunic or shirt.
And, even, also, namely.
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.
Dorcas, the Greek name of Tabitha. Gazelle; Dorcas, a Christian woman.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
